description:
Mediocre food. Coconut soup (tom kha) extremely bland and flavorless. Veg eggrolls were soggy in the inside and crispy in the out. The only thing I enjoyed was the thai iced tea.  Glad they at least knew how to make that tasty.   Don't think I'd come back.. unless iws in the area and wanted their tea. 

Happy eating
author: Tru T.

description: We got pad Thai wid chicken and chicken satay. Food was greasy, small quantity and not fresh. Sweet flavor was overpowering in pad Thai. Would not recommend this place.
author: Nidhi D.

description: We ended up at Banana House, because when we got to our first choice restaurant, it was closed. Granted it was Labor Day, so that is to be expected, but luckily Banana House was open. They greeted us at the door and were very friendly and attentive. We shared the Pad Thai with chicken and upgraded to a combo which comes with a salad, rice and egg roll. Then I added peanut sauce, because I like to dip things in there. The portion was generous enough for us to share, and we pretty much finished off the plate. The Pad thai had a good taste, but was not spicy. We could have added more heat, but ended up incorporating the peanut sauce, which was delish. The peanut sauce had a smooth consistency but packed a good peanut flavor. The egg roll was tasty too. Overall it was a good place to stop by for lunch.
author: Sandra V.

description: I ordered the tofu pad Thai and mango sticky rice. The service was great, but the food was mediocre and restaurant is pretty run down.
author: Mallory S.

description: This place sucks.  I walk in at 8:35 and they said we close at 9 And I said that's OK I will be out of here by then and they were like no we don't want to serve you and then they were just completely rude after that I would not go here ever ever again I highly recommend you go anywhere else
author: Steve N.

description:
This place wasn't awful but man, it sure wasn't great. The only thing that was nice about it was that it was walking distance from where my mom and I were staying. We had walked over 7 miles that day and my mom didn't want to hoof it too much more for dinner.

We ordered a stir-fry dish and a curry and DAMN that food was spicy! I grew up on spicy food and my mom is Vietnamese and adds jalapeños and chili paste to everything and we were struggling.

Two other things that stick out was the rice was old (it had crusty hardened grains) and when I ordered regular hot tea, the water wasn't even hot. I saw they just put tap water in a cup and microwaved it.
author: Jasmyn M.

description: I get pad Thai here for lunch pretty regularly. It always tastes good, the service is great and efficient and it's generally very convenient. I haven't dined in here, but as a pick up and go lunch option it's really good.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Bad service, did not get an order started till 20 min later. Did not like the food taste like frozen food. Definitely not coming back
author: Christina L.

description:
Sometimes a few simple words best describe an experience at a restaurant. I think this is the case with this one. 

Let's try it. 

- Impersonal: You are just a bag of money to these people. They won't smile at you, won't recommend anything, don't appear to enjoy their job much. 

- Pushy: You can't really have a conversation with your friends or colleagues because they want you in and it as soon as possible. This means throwing the check at you as soon as you are halfway through your meal and constantly hovering waiting for you to leave. 

- Overpriced: yes, this place is in a great spot for work lunches or tourists near Union Sq. Area. Still doesn't mean you need to come. The food is OK, depending on what you get. Chicken is dry, usually, and the noodles are super oily. For that, you pay 3x what you should. 

One more word. 

- Skip.
author: R. B.

description:
This place was not worth the money.. $12 per plate with portion sizes that can probably not make you very full... I ordered the a banana house special (or something like that) and a pad Thai. They are both stir fried noodles with one being a thick flat noodle and the other a thinner noodle. The banana boat house special was abundant in vegetables but it was way too oily. The pad Thai didn't really taste authentic and definitely did not taste like the pad Thai I'm used to eating.. 

I don't think I would come back here mainly because of the price and the quality of the food that I'm paying for.
author: Amy L.

description:
This is a decent choice if you're craving thai food in the Fidi. It was fairly busy when I visited around 12:30. Plenty of seating, good spot to grab lunch with a coworker.

I ordered the yellow chicken curry through MealPal, and while the flavor and spice level was on point, the carrots and onions were really underdone and few and far between.
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
Same experience as others on here, except I may have got food poison.. 

  The menu said parties of 5 or more would get gratuity added in automatically, yet our party of four did as well. We almost double tipped but caught it.

  Here I am the next day in my hotel hurting bad in the stomach. I got the green curry, and had to pay extra for white rice (really??) The rest of the table did like thier meals however, but we we're all famished.

 The cups with what I assume was tap water were very dirty. A woman was cutting Basil at a table behind. The whole place is dirty.  Thier cute sign is all they got going for them.  For shame.
author: Sign S.

description:
Ample seating in a seemingly small restaurant- they have another floor downstairs that they seated us in for our party of 6. Service is quick, food comes out pretty fast. 

Tried both their Pad Thai and Pad See Ew. They were ok - pad see ew here is a little sweeter than what I'm used to. We also ordered spring rolls for the table, which was not what we expected! Came in two big pieces with tofu, lettuce, other vegetables... the wrap wasn't in the clear rice paper that I usually imagine spring rolls to be in. 

Overall, I would say that Banana house is a convenient restaurant to get your quick Thai fix. Since service is fast, this place would be ideal for a lunch break or even just a quick meal while walking around town.
author: Esther K.

description: Had Panang Curry with brown rice. The curry was spicy, with lots of veggies and tofu. And avocado as well. I loved it. The service was quick and usually there's no wait time. A lot of Thai places add too much ice which dilutes the Thai Ice Tea. This place had just perfect.
author: Shreyans M.

description: Pretty small portion of Thom Kha coconut soup. Veggies didn't taste very fresh nor did the tofu. Considered sending it back but was pressed for time at lunch so ate It begrudgingly.
author: Jose U.

description: This place saved me because I was majorly hypoglycemic prior to finding it. I agree, it's expensive - $12 + tax for my chicken pad Thai. It was a tad too sweet but it was made to order and came steaming hot with lots of chicken. It made me smile to eat in the corner window seat by myself and gaze at L&L Hawaiian Drive-inn across the street, because I am from Hawaii.
author: KJ N.

description:
This review is for the dessert that I had - the mango sticky rice - and the experience in the restaurant itself. I always have super high expectations for desserts since I have such a large sweet tooth, but I typically raise my expectations for any mango dessert because... well mangoes are amazing and are my absolute favorite fruit!

All in all, this mango sticky rice wouldn't be something that I would pay for again. Maybe if they decreased the price (I honestly expected a bill of $4-5 max for a dish that small, but I was charged almost $8 not including tip!). My main issue with this dessert is the price though. The actual dish tasted fine - mangoes were sweet, even though it was a small portion size, and the sticky rice was perfectly cooked and had a really nice marriage with the coconut milk that it was mixed with. Again, I have to stress the fact that the small portion size and the fact that the dish wasn't THAT extraordinary made me think that it was not worth the price that I paid. 

In terms of the restaurant experience, it wasn't bad. Servers were prompt and polite, though not the friendliest group. There's lots of seating in the restaurant, so I'd expect there not to be a huge wait at any time.

Overall, there just wasn't super memorable about my experience at Banana House. I guess I'll have to try the savory foods at some point to make a more informed impression of the restaurant in the future...
author: Sheila D.

description: Sorry, this place used to be pretty good, back when it had the hot table for lunch. Those days are long gone, and now after several experiences of waiting way too long for to-go orders, amounting to $12+ for rather small, unexciting portions, I'm not going back.
author: Wayne Q.

description:
Not a repeat.  Overpriced, small portions, and food not so good.

Waitress soft spoken and that gives them 3 stars.
author: Robert C.

description:
Came here for lunch at noon. Come here before noon to get seated if you're rushing back to work.

Comparable with Vanda Thai Restaurant on Sacramento Street.

Had tom yum soup with shrimp and pad kee mao with beef.

If you need to eat within an hour and get back to work, this will suit your needs. Again, it does the trick of getting you full for lunch! 

Tom yum soup had a smoker flavor more than the usual sourness. Lots of mushrooms and the shrimp was a good addition.

Pad kee mao had enough noodles. I'm glad because other restaurants tend to add more veggies than noodles and protein.
author: Mary H.

description: Hole in the wall place for sure. But the pad Thai was lit (flavorful). Customer service was great! Food was served quickly and my water was refilled promptly.
author: Alexa N.

description: The food is good, and authentic Thai food (my favorite)!! Only thing is the bad customer service, they are rude and unprofessional. I feel like I am inconveniencing them by grabbing lunch from them. It is not a culture issue, even tho they make me feel like they are discriminating me. I had my 4th unpleasant encounter with the man at the register today, and I have decided to look for an alternative near work. I cannot subject myself to having this unpleasant feeling while eating my lunch. You have to feel good when you pick up lunch, you have to make more effort to make your patrons feel good about spending money on your establishment.
author: LoveAlways J.

description:
The food was decent. I think the value is very low. 11 for pad Thai and for most basic dishes? No thanks. I know this is the fidi, but the food isn't amazing, the decor and ambiance are bad and non existent.  $8 might work, but $11 plus tax, plus the health tax, plus tip puts you in the $14 range for simple non- fancy dishes. Nothing fancy in the plating and crammed very close to other diners.

Not something I'll be back to anytime soon and definitely not a go to place. 

I don't like to bash places, I just think the prices are too high and what you get in food and experience just isn't worth it.  Sorry.
author: Ty C.

description:
3.5

ATMOSPHERE:
Very quiet when I came. It was a little after lunch, so I assumed people went back to work. I was seated in a small table in the corner since it was just me.

FOOD:
I ordered the red curry which came with rice and salad and it was on point! The spiciness was perfect and there was enough meat that came with the curry. Usually, the problem I've faced with this was that there wasn't enough meat.

CUSTOMER SERVICE:
It was on point. I would assume since I was one of the very few patrons in the restaurant. My waitress was nice and seemed like she knew very little English. However, this did not deter her from helping me out by answering all my questions.

I also find it a little amusing that they charge people to use the bathrooms for $2 haha.
author: Aj C.

description: I absolutely love this place if you're looking for authentic Thai food this is the best spot. This place is also very convenient and fast. The people that work here are very friendly as well. I had the spaghetti kee mao with chicken if you're looking for something a little spicy. All in all I would give this place a 10/10. I would love to come back here again!
author: Kathy W.

description: this is my goto Thai place for lunch.  Great yellow curry.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Recently I had the chance to go to Banana House during the lunch hour, it is definitely a very small space but luckily the seating was fast. My friend and I ordered our food and the food was decent.

The reason I am giving Banana House 1 star is because of the quick service however, when my friend and I paid for the bill with card and left a zero on the tip line we were attacked by staff with complete unprofessionalism (name-calling), attitude, and were asked to leave because we didn't leave a tip, which I believe was not the appropriate way to a approach the situation. 

-Normally I leave cash tips, not tips on my card.

Advice to peeps- if you plan on eating here don't expect above and beyond service but expect to leave a tip for it anyway.
author: Jocelyn P.

description: The Thai food is good but I don't feel the meal is a good value.
author: Dennis W.

description:
This place definitely isn't great. There are many better thai restaurants featured out here in San Francisco. The Pad Thai was gummy, and the Thai Ice Tea was AWFUL. It left an awful chemical taste coated throughout my entire mouth, and the restaurant isn't very clean to begin with.

Check out Kin Khao nearby, or another spot. Your money is spent better elsewhere!
author: Anders Z.

description: It's a solid three stars. I personally add one more star since it's right next to my office and they were fast. I had chicken pad thai, which was good. I might consider returning when I need a pad thai fix that's convenient but not something that stood out to me.
author: Rose R.

description:
I popped into Banana House in the middle of a weekday lunch rush.  I've had this place, along with several other Belden Place establishments, bookmarked for months.  Although they were busy, I was determined to tough it out and try their lunch takeout. 

First of all, they are available on the Eat24 app.  Yay!  I'm a big fan of punching in an order and having it delivered or ready for pickup.  (Next time I'll remember this!)  The takeout ordering area is pretty much non-existent, so online/app ordering is certainly the way to go.  After I placed my order I stood outside to make way for dining room patrons.  There really isn't a waiting area option here.

My order was taken promptly and my takeout order popped up in about 7 minutes.  

While I waited, I watched the line chefs and wait staff frantically buzz about.  These folks are quick and on the ball!  I did overhear a frazzled single dining-in customer complain about slow service and other takeout customer complain about long wait times.  Personally, I wasn't in a rush, so I found the entire process to be fair.  

I went with #31 with chicken, param with steamed chicken, broccoli, and carrots.  The peanut sauce was packed alongside rice (choice between brown or white) and a small salad.  The sauce was excellent and the steamed meal was even better.  In an area filled with authentic speedy Asian food it was such a welcome relief to find a mean that wasn't fried, drenched in oil, or overly heavy.  The tiny salad on the side was a nice touch.

I will certainly be back for pad see ew, curry, papaya salad, and pad thai.  I peeked at several plates in the dining room while I waited and they look excellent!

Final verdict:  Don't let the hole-in-the-wall facade fool you-- this place is legit!
author: Andrea H.

description: They charge $2 for non paying customers to use the restroom so I decided to buy the mango sticky rice. It was good. Everyone was polite.
author: Neda O.

description: Pretty tasty pad see ew with tofu but is it worth $13.05? You'll definitely find Fidi price here. I'll think twice about coming here for this reason.
author: Jing D.

description:
This place is awful. The tom yum soup broth is decent, but the vegetables in it were bland and scarce. The fresh rolls (pictured) were almost inedible, and the sauces they came with were even worse (a sickeningly sweet plum based thing and an overpowering peanut concoction)! 

I paid $20 for these two unfortunate snacks and regret every cent. Avoid at all costs.
author: Jessica C.

description: The place was not clean and tidy. And the water didn't look like it was safe to drink. No, seriously don't drink it. But the food. Specifically the in-house Banana House duck noodles was perfection. Cannot really put it in words, it was sooo good.
author: Ganesh K.

description:
The Banana House, what a strange name for a Thai place! I was walking by and I slipped in, for a little late afternoon meal! The place was pretty empty around 1:45pm on a Sunday, only one other customer and a few pick up orders! 
The service was great, speedy and I was in and out the door in 20 minutes! 

The Yellow Curry was really good, maybe not spicy enough for some but I thought the flavor was pretty spot on. The tofu was the perfect amount of crispy friend goodness! Not many veggies here, but the potatoes hit the spot! 

I do dig that they offer you steamed white or brown rice, and that I was in and out the door so fast! Heck I'm in San Fran I got stuff to do, and it much better to do on a tummy full of thai!  In other words slip in sometime.
author: Patrick T.

description:
My friends and I decided to go here and eat since we saw it on our way to Plentea (I also reviewed Plentea). Banana House is a pretty small to medium sized restaurant.
Ambience: Pretty much like any authentic Asian-like restaurant. It's nothing extremely fancy but it's not super dirty either. It's just in between.
Service: The lady was very kind. There was not that much interaction besides the occasional "how are things?" and "would you like more water?".
Food: We had ordered the Fresh Spring Rolls, Pad Thai (tofu), and Green Curry (chicken). Let me just say that everything was absolutely delicious. I've never tried a Thai Spring roll and it was really good. The flavoring of the Pad Thai was tasty and the green curry was pretty spicy but the spices and flavoring of it all was yummy.
Overall: I enjoyed this place a lot.
author: Shannon C.

description:
This one of the dozens of places on Kearny and thereabouts that earn their profits on the lunch rush.
As far as the basics go it's good verging on great. The fried rice with tofu is awesome as is the thai style tea and coffee. It's hard to go wrong with pad thai. 
I've never had any issues with the service, even during peak rush, and I've always had great meal experiences. 
This place is totally on my lunch rotation.
author: Steven W.

description: Delicious food. Great prices. We shared 6 dishes and loved them all. Service was great. The coconut mango desert was to die for.
author: Paras B.

description:
I spend twenty dollars which was not cheap for the simple lunch but the quality of food was far less than the price I've paid for it.  The spicy cat fish wasn't that fish dish because there was only a few tiny pieces of fish and rest of them are plain vegi.  Everything was below expectation and nothing special.  I wonder how this place can sustain in the future.
I will pass it next time.
author: Piano B.

description:
Staff was very polite and helpful. Very cramped place so get cozy!

$9 for a red curry with chicken. It was very small... One scoop of rice, one ladle of curry and a small scoop of salad. Curry is ok. Mildly spicy. A lot of oil though... Chicken was well made and not dry. Still prefer Osha's curry. I might come back to try other dishes on the menu.
author: Benita M.

description:
We just ordered lunch for 16 people to be delivered to our work. I asked them for menu to show my coworkers and choose what to order. They gave me the printed version which appeared to have an old prices. When they called me with the total price - I decided to come there and ask why it it about $20-$25 more than suppose to be- the answer was -We have a different price now    but gave you the old printout. No apologies- just told me- we can cancel your order if you want. Do they think- we will ever go there again.
If I read people review- I will not go there and would order lunch at the other place
author: Lyuba S.

description: Food taste okay. Not bad but portions were tiny. Like super tiny for $12. Service was slow. Attitude when asked for extra plates and forks. Only Thai restaurant where I work. My only options so I will be going back but not any time soon.
author: Sandy B.

description: I don't usually write reviews but this place sucked! I ordered Pad Thai with beef and it came out with 5 pieces of beef and when I paid them tip according to the service I got the manager comes and and tells me you're only tipping x amount, and asked me to tip more. I'm never going to go there again. Shitty service and shitty management.
author: Iyvin B.

description:
I had been on a long walking tour of Chinatown, and in the afternoon was making my way back around to Union Square when I started looking for a place to eat. Preferably a quiet place, but not empty, and with seating. This was the place, and the fact that it was Thai I considered a bonus.  
  
There was one other customer inside, at a window table. He was a middle-aged businessman, engaged more with his phone than anything else.  He left before he finished. It seemed like a work-day kind of place, unpretentious. Un-touristy.  
  
The menu was printed in plain text on a white laminated sheet. Numbers next to the names of the dishes. I was offered a cup of ice water. There was no beer. I ordered #35 Pad Kra Pao (ground chicken in spicy garlic sauce with beans, onions, bell peppers, basil) because I wanted a meat dish, and I was looking for some inspiration for what to do with ground chicken at home.  
  
My phone battery was dipping so I mostly watched the traffic go by while I waited. Nobody else came in during my visit and the staff talked among themselves while the cook worked. The street is interesting, short buildings with tall office towers rising behind them from the other side of the block. An adequate supply of pigeons.  
  
The food arrived shortly. The ground chicken with vegetables were in a small bowl with the sauce, and a mound of rice was presented on another dish. I pressed down the mound and added the pad kra pao to it for each bite, and found it a satisfying meal. The sauce was delicious, I wanted more before I was done. At length I ordered a Coke to supplement, and it was served as an unopened can with a cup of ice.  
  
Overall I had a good experience here. The menu had something that interested me, it wasn't too busy, and although the presentation was basic, it advertised itself as Thai food, and it tasted like Thai food. I got the feeling there might be a restaurant in Thailand that would not be too dissimilar to this one. Just a regular place, but authentic.  
  
As to the food safety advisory, I noticed a carton of half and half sitting out the entire time (maybe 40 mins). I had no problems myself.
author: Jay S.

description: They served me raw chicken. If i get sick in the next few days you know where i got it from. Their meat smells old.  Never again.
author: Jorydude r.

description: Good chicken yellow curry. salad and egg roll and thai iced tea combo was $13.50 plus tax. A little pricier than Thai Noodle House on O'Farroll street. They charge $2 to use the bathroom for non customers. Again the food and service were good!
author: Ben L.

description: it's pretty hard to find a decent price thai restaurant in the financial district since almost everything is overpriced. i ordered the beef pad thai here because i love eating pad thai. it was just okay tasting, nothing special. but then again, most restaurants in the financial district aren't that great. there are definitely better thai restaurants in the city. my pad thai was a bit spicy. whenever i order pad thai at other thai restaurants, it isn't usually spicy :/ (i'm not a spicy eater)  this place gets pretty packed during lunch time on weekdays. there's lot of seating and there's outdoor seating too.
author: Sylvia H.

description:
I came here for lunch with my sister kind of by default because we're still scoping out new eats now that her office building has moved locations. She had been here before with coworkers, so I figured it would be an easy standby. I ordered the papaya salad and my sister got the pineapple fried rice. My sister finished her meal easily and mine was pretty satisfying. My serving was decently sized (luckily I wasn't too hungry anyways) and came with a few large shrimp. It was nicely dressed and crisp to perfection.

They have a counter with food in hot trays for quick and easy takeout (for that hardworking crowd that can barely step out of the office for lunch). The dining area itself is definitely no frills and I probably wouldn't have tried this place if it weren't for my sister's suggestion.

It was decently priced and the food was solid. I may come back, but there's definitely plenty of other places to try in the area.
author: Leana L.

description:
We stopped by this Thai restaurant for lunch while walking around Chinatown today. We came in around 1:30 PM and found the place to be about half full so we were seated fairly quickly.

I ordered the Pad Kra Pao (ground chicken in spicy garlic sauce with beans, onions, bell peppers, basil) and my girlfriend ordered the Pad Thai. 

The Pad Kra Pao was delicious! The meat was well cooked and it was full of flavor. Dish also came with a salad (eh, basically lettuce with vinaigrette) and white rice. The rice perfectly complimented the stir fried ground chicken and vegetables!

The pad Thai that my girlfriend got was also really good. They threw in extra vegetables for her which was nice since she didn't want any of the protein options. They had just the right amount of all of the ingredients, but maybe could've used a little more flavoring. 

The only con I would note is that the service was not great. We had to ask multiple times for chopsticks and straws for our drinks. The waitresses did not seem as attentive, but this was honesty not a big deal.

Overall we left with empty plates and full bellies!
author: Jimmy C.

description: We went out for lunch during primetime and were met with long lines just about everywhere. My buddy had eaten at Banana House before, and mentioned that while they looked full, they also had a secret downstairs area, so we were able to get right in. I was absolutely starving, so I got a combo, which was an egg roll, small salad, thai iced tea, and green curry chicken. It had just the right amount of spice for me- a little kick but it didn't leave me crying. Service was slow but they were very crowded, so that's to be expected. Lunch was about $20 for me with tax and tip. I'd definitely come back here.
author: Alyssa J.

description:
Came here for lunch with my coworkers and since we had a large group (party of 7), we got a table in the basement. I had the duck curry with brown rice which was decent, although the coconut juice left much to be desired. 

Service was fast and efficient. They provide free soup for lunch.

Decent spot for lunch, although slightly on the pricier side with no lunch specials menu.
author: Christina N.

description:
Pretty good Thai place on Kearny, Banana House offers food I usually crave for dinner at lunchtime. The restaurant is cute: white table clothes atop little tables, wood walls, big windows. The wait staff is nice, fast, and attentive.

I get the lunch special Green Chicken Curry and my friend gets the Duck Curry, both are very good and filling. The meal starts off with a small cabbage soup, then comes your plate with salad, brown or white rice, and your main dish, full of bell peppers, tender chicken, green curry sauce, eggplant, and basil. They have chopped peanuts, chili peppers, and hot sauce to add kick to your dish. I like to add a little hot sauce to the cabbage soup since it's kind of mild and bland.

Knocked off one star because it's a little pricey for an Asian-style lunch special (I'm used to $6-$8 for lunch spesh): around $11 per meal, but since the food is good and likely healthier than getting a sandwich or pizza, it's a go-to spot for me. Lunch takes around 20 minutes or so once you're sitting down, so plan accordingly if you're like me and have a measly half hour for lunch.
author: Crystal C.

description: I've been here a couple times. The first time I had pad thai and it was really good. The second time I went for their thai iced tea to go. She filled the WHOLE cup with ice and just a small amount of tea. I asked for less ice, and she said it'd be 50 cents more. Kinda ridiculous. The service here has been pretty unfriendly.
author: Madeleine M.

description:
I don't know why Banana House only has 3 stars, I've been coming here since I worked in the Financial District and I've never had an issue with them. They're always really nice to me and make sure I have everything I need.

I LOVE THEIR MANGO STICKY RICE. Honestly, I could eat it every day and never ever get sick of it. 

I love their yellow curry and their chicken satay. Lunch special for around $10 and enough food to have two meals. Yep, I'm happy. 

Seriously tho... mango sticky rice.
author: Devyn P.

description: Omg was very bad food. Wings were salty as ever!  We asked for a little spicy and got fire truck hot!! Plate was dirty. You have to put your mouth on a plastic glass as no straws are offered unless you purchased a specialty drink like Thai Iced tea or something. I give this place 1 star!
author: Cornelius J.

description: Totally get the "poor food safety" alert that just popped up. Let's just say the cook isn't big on hygiene. That said, the Tom Ka Gai is DELICIOUS. Probably not a place for someone with a weak stomach, but worth a try.
author: Darija W.

description:
Just an ok Thai restaurant in fidi. I've been on the lookout for a year now for some good Thai restaurants in the area, but I haven't been very successful. This is one of the only ones I know about and it's not amazing. 

I've ordered the pad kee mao, red curry tofu, and basil tofu. The texture of the tofu is pretty good but this food is VERY oily. After eating just half of my meal, I always feel very bloated and kind of sick. The taste is decent but I don't think this is good quality Thai food. The dishes are pretty spicy so beware - ask for mild if you can't tolerate spicy food. Red curry doesn't have any veggies except for bell pepper and even then, there's not a lot of them. I usually expect Thai curry to have a lot of vegetables so I'm not a huge fan of the curry. Pad kee mao and basil tofu are both decent. 

Since this is the only Thai place I know of in the area, I guess I'll keep going, but I still be on the lookout for a better place!
author: Malika R.

description: Lunch was packed but the food was disappointing. Chicken Penang curry was bland... Didn't quite taste like curry. The chicken was very dry.
author: Ruby C.

description:
I never write reviews on Yelp but really wanted to share this since I got food poisoning from here.

About 2 weeks ago, I ordered a glass noodle salad here for lunch. As soon as I tasted it, I knew something wasn't right. I even joked and told my co workers that I might have to go home that afternoon after eating it.

By 6pm that day, I was throwing up in the bathroom. I was sick for the next week and kept waking up with cold sweats in the middle of the night. I felt so sick I couldn't eat any solids and took me a good 2 weeks to recover.

Now that I am finally well enough to type again, I wanted to post this immediately. 

This review is purely to help all of you out there who don't want to get sick. Please do not order the glass noodle salad here and make sure the food you get here won't make you feel sick.
author: Eva C.

description: Food was excellent and relatively well-priced for the portions (I barely finished my plate of fried rice). My friends are vegetarians and were both able to find meals that not only fit their dietary restrictions, but were also appetizing. It seems like I came in during an off hour between typical lunch and dinner times, so it was empty but for my party, and so service was quick and attentive without being overbearing. There's lots of space in the restaurant, and overall is a nice small business I was glad to support, and would willingly do so again.
author: Gina L.

description:
A tiny container of green curry - $11. 
Two bland pad see ew - $22 
Not worth it. Will never order from here again.
author: CY C.

description:
FOOD
- Chicken Pad Thai (3 Stars): I love me some Pad Thai, so this is always my default dish to order. I was a little disappointed that you had to pay extra for prawns...it should be included! But they provided an ample amount of chicken and it wasn't dry. Noodles were firm and not squishy. Sauce was sweet with some slight heat. But the sauce wasn't sickenly sweet either, which is a pet peeve of mine. $7.95 for a generous portion (my friend was able to fill a whole take-out box with leftovers). 
- Thai Iced Tea (5 Stars): Finally a place that doesn't dump sugar into your Thai iced tea! I feel like boba places and other restaurants are very heavy handed with the sugar or syrup that is in the teas. I didn't even have to ask this place to half the sugar. It was a perfect combo of tea, milk, sweetener, and ice. A huge glass for only $1.95.

ATMOSPHERE
This is clearly a busy lunch spot for ppl working downtown. The interior is so-so, but this isn't meant to be a classy restaurant. Yummy food is often found in hole-in-the-wall places!

TOTAL
3.5 stars overall--nothing really stands out except for the Thai iced tea, but the price is good for the amount of food you're getting.
author: Bonnie Z.

description: The banana house fried rice was very salty. I had to drink 2 cups of water just to get it down and the cups didn't look very clean
author: Nick N.

description:
an aye-okay place to get thai food if you're in the fidi district. i got the pad thai to go, and got it relatively quickly.  decided not to get the thai tea from other reviews, and they didn't have boba.

the portion was good for what i paid, but there wasn't enough sauce to make it taste as good as normal pad thai.  if i'm craving thai, maybe i will come back. but at this time, it was just an okay meal.
author: My An V.

description:
Not much spazzy flavor to Thai cuisine!

My coworker helped me order up their Pad See Ew while my manager treated us to lunch.  It was bland compared to other Thai restaurants that I have tried of the same dish before! 

They provide a nice dining area to lounge at, but their Thai food isn't up to par!

They need to spice up their dishes in order for it to be called Thai food!
author: Tiffany D.

description:
I had first come to this place in early January of 2010. I had just landed in SF for my job interview the next day, and was looking for a place to grab a bite before I fall asleep (had just gotten back from india and was really jetlagged!)... I got out of my hotel and randomly walked around town, and somehow ended up in the financial district where i discovered this completely empty restaurant (sunday afternoon in FiDi).. The thai curry was pretty good, and being their only customer, service was fast!

Yelp did not have check-in's back then, and I did not really care to remember where I ate. Three years down the line, I suddenly remembered this place, but couldn't, for the life of me, figure out where it was and what it was called. I only vaguely remembered the interiors of this place, but knew absolutely nothing else about it.

WTF Yelp, why can't you get into my head and tell me about the restaurant I am thinking of! Their search team needs to get their act together and index my brain!

Anyways, last week, as I was making my way down to Enjoy Vegetarian in Chinatown, a sudden pang of laziness directed me into the nearest decent-looking restaurant, and lo and behold.. I had finally found it !!!

I consider music and restaurants to be things that people associate memories to, and then irrationally like or dislike based on how their lives were going when they initially encountered it. For example, I really love Rainforest Cafe in Fisherman's Wharf because I had first visited it whilst on an epic vacation with my friends back in 2008. I don't care how bad or overpriced their food might be today, that place will always be one my favorite places in the city because of all the great moments it can remind me of!

Similarly this place takes my mind outside its current petty worries and tribulations, and make it consider the past 3 years of my life as a whole. As they say, fruit flies like a banana! A lot happens over 3 years, and most of it seems to have been for good! This place will definitely gets 5 stars from me as well as a lot of future check-in's!

Their yellow thai curry and vegetarian egg rolls are pretty awesome!
author: Aditya M.

description:
I went there with my friend who is a vegetarian, there was a male taking our order, we were asking him if we could order a Pad Thai without meat, he was ignoring us and talking to his coworkers. We called him again and he finally came over and yelled out :"Pad Thai supposed to have meat, I can't make you no meat!"
How mean was he?? Then we said ok it's fine, we go somewhere else and thanked him, but he was in a bad temper and threw his pen on the table! 
I would not go back again!
author: Jo L.

description:
Crazy busy during the lunch rush, so everyone ignores you. Ordered 2 things:

1. Thai iced tea, no cream (not a huge fan, prefer it without). Instead, I got one that was 80% cream. Couldn't even taste the tea. Sometimes Thai restaurants give it to me with cream and I let it go. They ran off before I could even protest. I'll take it with some cream, but not that much!

2. Fried tofu with peanut sauce. It's an appetizer, I get that. But he told me it came with peanut sauce and I ordered a little extra just in case. It definitely didn't come with peanut sauce and it came with 8 pieces of tofu. The place I go to in Marin comes with way more for less money.

For $13+, I'll take a hard pass in the future. As a member of the service industry, I try to not rate 1 stars, but I had to. Unfortunately for the lower-star reviewers for this business, it won't take the advice to heart and make any changes due to the FiDi lunch rush.
author: Brituhknee S.

description:
I knew I shouldn't have ignored the 3-stars on yelp.

Ended up coming here for lunch with coworkers because the curry place next door was closed. I was very skeptical of the 3-star reviews but my coworkers wanted to give it a shot.

First of all their setup for ordering takeout is terrible. Everyone's just waiting at the very narrow entrance and it's cramped. While ordering, my coworker tried to add on additional spring rolls, and got straight up denied: "We're very busy now and have bad communication with the kitchen so we can't add more spring rolls." WTF does that even mean? Why did he get denied food??

After I received my food, I asked for hot sauce and received one container filled with it. I realized my coworkers didn't get any to go so I asked for two more, and was told that would cost me 50 cents. WTF? Did you just charge me for hot sauce that you can eat as much as you want at the restaurant? I told the lady it was for my coworkers and not all for me, so she didn't end up charging me.

So now we're eating and a few bites into my pad thai I find a super long piece of hair. Disgusting.

Nobody was satisfied with the food either. All in all a terrible experience and you shouldn't waste your money here.
author: J. D.

description: Decent Thai food with quick service and tables. It gets noisy with all the small conversations going on. I ordered the pad see ew noodles and cousin got the pad Thai. We both thought they were tasty. Portions were ample for lunch. It's not the best Thai food I've eaten and it's not the worst either - a solid 3. The Thai iced tea was a little watered down. I typically go to Osha but I like supporting small business so I will start coming here more when I am on Kearny street.
author: Bebe W.

description:
Walking back from China town, we happen to stumble upon this inconspicuous Thai restaurant. You're not going to ever stop me from going into a Thai place. It was decent inside, standard decor, but I'm ready for the fare.

We started with their spring rolls, which were very different from any other place. The texture was similar to an a Filipino Lumpia, very crepe like. It was surprising, to get that instead of the traditional fried or fresh rice noodle wrap. I had a bite of the pad thai, which was good, rich in flavor and having it's own unique touch from this place.

However, I concentrated on the dish Traffic Jam. It's a dish that has all three curry styles; regular, red, and green.  What's wonderful about this dish is that you can literally go from one curry flavor to another and each time refresh your pallet with an amazing new flavor. It's genius! One minute, I thought green was my favorite, then it was red. Amazingly confusing to have them side by side like that. For several bites, I was loving the green, it's a little sweeter and tart compared to the other two, but when I switched back to red, I'm sold, throw in the towel, I'm a red curry kind of guy. This was so much fun to eat. The regular curry flavor was my least favorite, that's not to say it wasn't good, just not my favorite compared to red. I would certainly get this if you want to have fun eating and playing around with flavors.
author: Randy G.

description: low life garbage - they ripped m e off - i ordered a plate and told them please add vegetables- she did not add anything and charged me 16.50 for a plate that consisted of rice and 5 pieces of shrimp- this low life useless eater- i hope they go out of business and put all their money in the hospital.low life thieves
author: Marbi F.

description:
I went to this place for a to-go dinner order. It was very empty but several people were waiting for their take-away food.
The manager (I assume) is a very friendly and chatty guy who makes you feel welcome at his restaurant. He even sat down with me on a table to talk about my order and about other stuff.

I ordered the Pad Thai. This is most of the time a safe order and mostly tastes good. This one was good. I would not put it on the list of my top Pad Thai's I've ever eaten but it was decent and the portion was more than filling.
As drink I took the Thai Iced Tea and must mention here, that this one is in my top list of Thai Iced Teas, it was the way I liked it!

The reason why I gave this place four stars is, because the owner was very friendly, the thai iced tea very good and the pricing for decent food very affordable. I would definitely go there for another dinner to-go.
author: Vera H.

description: Duck curry and pad Thai were very good. Spring rolls were different from any I've ever had but we're also very good.
author: Erin K.

description: Unfortunately I decided to eat at this place as soon as I arrived in San Francisco because it was close to the hotel. I ordered some egg rolls which turned out to be nothing more than a greasy mess. I attempted the soup twice, first I sent back because it was cream based despite not being explained on the menu. And the second kind was barely edible seeing as the shrimp still had feces attached and the chicken looked like something that had been pressed and pieced together. I would have just been content with the broth had there been any flavor. What a waste of money and time.
author: Lisa V.

description: Ordered Spicy Eggplant with chicken, which was good.  We also ordered a papaya salad and tom yum soup, both with shrimp.  While the shrimp were fresh, none of them were deveined.  none.  that's about 8 shrimp.  We did it ourselves.  I cannot recall ever going to a restaurant that doesn't devein their shrimp.  It wasn't busy either.
author: S e.

description:
Kind of just average. I ordered my usual Thai dish - pad see ew. I quite enjoyed the soup that they served with it which was pretty unconventional for Thai places. It was some type of onion/vegetable blend that was pretty tasty. The pad see ew wasn't as flavorful as I would have liked, but it wasn't as bad as many others that I've tried before. The chicken was very tender and they were generous with the vegetables in the dish. The decor and service were both average.

With the wide selection of restaurants within the same block and area, I'm not sure I would come back. However, I will still note that it's one of the better Thai restaurants around FiDi.
author: Sunny H.

description:
Good for lunch but nothing special. Don't make it a destination, its not that great. 

If your looking for something different for lunch stop on in but its not special. It's OK for the area I guess.
author: Justin S.

description:
Very simply, they refused to accept cash.  I ordered a to go meal. It was $10.90. Tried to pay the last 90 cents with three quarters, one dime, and five pennies.  They refused the pennies and insisted on a credit card or something other than pennies. Five pennies. It's not like I dumped 73 cents on them during a busy time.  And they wouldn't just take 85 cents and leave the pennies.  So I left. The food's not bad, I've been here plenty. 

I can't believe I'm writing one of these stupid  senseless Yelp reviews, but this place earned it.
author: Mark P.

description: If I'm craving Thai food for lunch this is where I usually end up. Their curries are good, pad Thai so-so. They really need a better lunch special. For $5 you can add a spring roll, a few leaves of lettuce, and a small ice tea. Totally not worth it. Way overpriced for mediocre food.
author: Anastasia J.

description:
I came on a Monday during lunch hour (12:30) and ordered take out.  It was bustling but they still got my order out in a very reasonable amount of time. 

I ordered the Thai Basil Salmon and it was pretty great.  The salmon came out cooked in a manner you would expect it to be when it's been stir-fried, and the taste of the sauce that the salmon was cooked in was delicious.  It's spice level was perfect and exactly what I would expect from a Thai dish, just enough to sizzle your tongue a little but not enough to over power the fresh Thai basil and peppers.  I should mention that I love spicy food.  If you're sensitive to spice, you might find it very spicy. 

I made the order a combo for $4.50, which comes with a side of thai salad, an eggroll, and a drink (I got Thai tea).  The salad was very weak and tiny. I ate it like in one bite.  The eggroll was pretty bland.  I would not opt for the combo next time and just get the Thai tea for $2.50.  The tea was delicious. 

I ordered take-out and the transaction was very rushed, as expected for as busy as they were.  I would not have expected anything more such as chit chat and friendly demeanor.  So friendly personable customer service is not on my radar for a place like this at a time such as lunch.  As long as they get my food out in a timely manner, which they did, that's all I ask for.  

Overall, good experience and food (the main course at least).  I would come back.
author: Heather G.

description: Great curry and spicy eggplant. Peanut sauce for the thai salad and the vegetarian eggrolls good too. Fast and friendly service.
author: Heidi W.

description: 2 Thai restaurants on the same block. I will give Banana house the edge over Bangkok Express. The food was much better. Against my better judgement, I ordered the fried rice and fried chicken dish. Yeah I know, not very healthy.  But it was pretty good. They did mess up my friend's order and got him the chicken pad see ew instead of the tofu pad see ew that he ordered. No harm, no fowl, it happens.
author: Sunil R.

description:
I usually order the Pad Kee Mao whenever I'm at a new Thai restaurant.  That's one of my favorite dishes, so if I was to try out somewhere new, why not start by judging them with my favorite noodle.

Tasted better than expected and it's pretty good for the financial district.  Our order took a little longer to come and they all came at a different time, which I thought was kind of weird, plus it wasn't even busy! It's a good place to go on a cold day if you want something tasty and hot....totally hits the spot!
author: Nancy S.

description:
Tried the peach curry: choice of chicken or tofu in red curry sauce w red bell peppers and basil.

It was tastey and different; I like peach curry with chicken!
The side of rice was fluffy,fresh and sweet tasting; and the side salad was fresh too.
$7.95 is a nice price.

Customer service: fast and good.

Parking: none outside; you need to find a parking area; this place caters to FiDi
workers, like me!

3 stars is fair.
author: Bert K.

description:
I had did my yelping and was actually bringing my friend to the curry place right next door. I guess I didn't yelp hard enough because that place didn't have seating so we came here.

The outer decor is very modern and every time I walk by there is a lot of people inside. We arrived around 12PM and the place was at half capacity. It did get full after 5 minutes after our arrival. Watching my weight I ordered the seafood salad with silver noodles. My friend ordered the silver noodle entree dish with beef. Our waitress was a bit hard of hearing. 

Waitress: "What kind of meat?"
Friend: "Beef"
Waitress: "What kind of meat?"
I eye my friend while thinking, "Is beef not a meat?"
Friend: "Beef" 

My salad came out a good 5 minutes before my friend's noodle dish came. It was a bit awkward. I was also a little disappointed on how small my meal looked BUT the dish is very deep so I was actually pleasantly satisfied after finishing. 

My friend's dish looks good too but it is more of your general noodle dish. 

They refilled our water and was attentive enough. They did give us our check after 15 minutes of our arrival so it was a bit unsettling. It felt like they wanted us to leave. We just started eating our food. I suppose it is understandable since there was a line of fidi people on their lunch break waiting in line. 

Not sure if I would come back.
author: Sarah C.

description:
There's nothing spectacular yet inherently bad about this restaurant. The decor is simple and leaves much to be desired - not much of a Thai feel can be found. 

My dish, the curry with beef, was better than expected. The beef was quite tender and the curry sweet and slightly tangy, great for lovers of the savory and sweet. For $10 during lunch, it'll come with a serving of jasmine rice and salad, and the whole dish was enough to last me 1.5 meals. Not bad overall, but for $10 there are many better options in the immediate area.
author: Jason T.

description:
Tried this place on my way Super Duper Burger. Decided to opt for noodles instead of a burger.

I ordered Phad See Eiw. The noodles were over cooked and had a mushy texture. Also the wok wasn't clean or it had carbon deposits. I can still taste that burnt flavor in my mouth. Moreover, no other flavor. It would be plain bland if I didn't taste burnt wok.

13$$ for that? I won't go back
author: Steven V.

description:
I came here with coworkers for lunch this week, they were really busy so we ended up sitting down stairs in the basement. 

To start we ordered the vegetable egg rolls. They were pretty good, a little too greasy for my taste, but the filling was yummy.

I ordered the green curry lunch special but we all ended up sharing our food. We had the house fried rice and the sinta green noodles, both with chicken.

The green curry came with eggplant, bell pepper, chicken, and some green beans. It was served with jasmine rice and some salad with a creamy peanut dressing. 

The fried rice was probably my favorite dish. It was different than any other fried rice I've ever had, the seasonings on it made it unique. It also had raisins, pineapple, and cashews mixed in, also things I've never come across in fried rice. Overall it was a really great dish everything came together really well.

The green sinta noodles were also very good. They came with chicken, chopped tomatoes, and broccoli. 

I like the food at Banana House but the service was pretty slow we were there almost 2 hours! I will be sure not to dine in for lunch again. I will try taking it to-go next time.
author: Stephanie T.

description: This place is not bad if you want some quick Thai food in FiDi. I always want to come back for more to support the friendly Thai family/friends that run this store. :)
author: Jeanette S.

description:
I'm highly susceptible to suggestion. Sometimes that can be a very, very bad thing. 

Today, however, it was a very, very good thing. 

This morning my foodie coworker emailed me a New York Times article about Southeast Asian curry soups. The delectable descriptions and photos left me with no doubt that I would be having curry something, curry ANYTHING, for lunch. 

Fortunately, this same foodie coworker followed through with a great suggestion: Banana House. 

While mere steps from my office, I had never tried Banana House, but all it took was one taste of my mango chicken curry to know that it would immediately go into my regular lunchtime rotation. 

Side benefit: The fiery curry helped boost my water consumption for the day!
author: Valeria R.

description:
I probably should have verified when my order for one entree and a Thai Iced tea came out to ~$18, but they gave me shrimp instead of the beef I ordered (which right off the bat was an extra three dollars). Didn't bother asking them to fix my order because I had waited at least 20 minutes for take out. 

When I went to eat it, the shrimp weren't fully de-legged, and I was still hungry afterward. For that quality of food, I expect to be full if I'm going to spend that much. Overall, a really poor experience. Overpriced, mediocre food and a long wait.
author: Camden A.

description:
This place is Ehhh!

I came here for lunch and just randomly chose this place.  I had the lunch special of chicken with veggies and a side of peanut salad.  My boyfriend had the beef with green beans.  Both entrees took awhile to come to us, it was cold and lack of flavor.  The only thing I could taste was the peanut dressing of the salad.  Also, they put us downstairs with no one else.  Either seat other people downstairs too or just have us wait.  It was really sad and lonely down there.
author: Melinda T.

description:
My coworkers and I ordered takeout from Banana House today for lunch. Since no one had cash and we didn't want to deal with splitting the bill onto 3 different cards, we each called to place our own order. I ordered the pad broccoli. "Chicken, beef or tofu?" "Can I have half chicken and half tofu?" "Sure. What kind of rice do you want? White, brown or sticky?" "Sticky" "Ok, see you soon"

The first guy was told 10 minutes, I was told 20-25 minutes, and someone else was told 15 minutes. So we weren't sure when to head over. Fortunately, when we arrived about 10-15 minutes later everything was ready.

I was surprised when the woman handed me my bill for $11.30 as I had ordered off the lunch special menu which was 7.95. She then explained they had charged me extra for both chicken and tofu, and extra for the sticky rice. "But you didn't tell me on the phone that those things cost extra". After several minutes of awkwardness they ended up charging me the right price. But the damage had been done. 

We brought our food back to the office and it was bad. I thought my stirfry lacked flavor and the "sticky" rice wasn't even sticky. My coworkers gave their curries 2.5 stars.

Will not return.
author: Rachel E.

description:
I believe this is the theme song of this hectic eatery on Kearny. Let me get my banjo... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ksuObVszb-Q

"Yes! We have no bananas 
We have no bananas today! 
We have string beans and onions...
Cabbages and scallions 
And all kinds of fruit and say 
We have an old fashioned tomato 
A nice juicy potato, but 
Yes! We have no bananas 
We have no bananas today!"

They do have a lot of standard Thai dishes though. Business is at a fever pitch during the lunch hour here. Madness, sheer madness. For some reason, I was given a table for four all by lonesome, just me and my iPhone. Not sure why, but I got glares from shopping whores looking to park their bags.

I went for one of their signature dishes, the $8.95 Pumpkin Curry. Decent. Just decent. It was served in a little square bowl with about four small strips of chicken, four chunks of pumpkin and ancillary vegetables. The scoop of rice seemed skimpy for the amount of curry, as was the salad which had a smear of peanut sauce on top. There were these flavorless chips served, but at least the crunch made a nice contrast.

I'm sure I'll come back at some point since I'm working nearby, but it would be nice if the quality of the food on the Kearny corridor could get a bit more of a lift. And yes, they do have bananas - fried with a scoop of ice cream. But not for me...have to get back to the office.

FOOD - 3 stars...a decent lunch-time option if you have a hankering for Thai
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...just a blur to me...lots of yellow and green and that was just the diners
SERVICE - 3.5 stars...speedy
TOTAL - 3 stars...I'm a banana in a banana house
author: Ed U.

description: I'm a regular here since it's right next to work. They are always so nice and generous here. And the food is delicious and comes out fast. I always get the mango fried rice or pad see ew. I can't speak to authenticity but the flavor and freshness is always on point.
author: matthew m.

description:
It's wet and cold outside, and we needed someplace close and fast for lunch.  Reservations for five at Banana House is what we come up with.

Taking advantage of their Weekday Lunch Special (any order of curry or Banana House plates come with an order of rice, fried wonton skins, and a side salad with peanut sauce), I had the Pumpkin Curry, soft pumpkin in spicy red curry sauce with tofu ($7.95), as recommended by Kam O.  It was tasty and had lots of pumpkin and tofu in this dish, with a nice spiciness to heat it up as well.  I think if the pumpkin was cooked a little longer, it would taste even better.  It wasn't exactly what I call "soft pumpkin".  

My colleagues had the Gang Dang, red curry in coconut milk with bamboo shoots, bell peppers, and basil with tofu ($7.95); Yellow Curry, yellow curry in coconut milk with onion, carrot, and potato with chicken ($7.95); Prik Khing, sauteed string beans in spicy sauce with basil and bell peppers with tofu  ($7.95); and the Seafood Curry, prawns, calamari, and mussels in red curry in coconut milk with basil and bell peppers ($8.95).  There was also an order of Thai tea ($1.95) as well.  Everyone finished their lunch, or took home the leftovers.  It was a nice comfort food for the dreary weather outside.

My colleagues arrived at the restaurant before I did and were seated downstairs.  As I made my way there, the waitress handed me the menus and directed me to bring it to my table.  Wtf?  Too lazy I guess.  I orders arrived VERY quickly and we appreciated that, especially with it being a weekday lunch.  However, soon after our dishes arrived, our check came too.  Now, we all know what that feels like.  They just can't get rid of you fast enough, I guess.  It wasn't super busy for a 12 noon lunch, and there was plenty of seating still available downstairs when we left at 12:40.  

We were actually very surprised with how quickly our food arrived and how fast we finished lunch.  With 20 minutes to spare, we took our time heading back to the office.  They also play Wild 94.9's Wild Workout at Noon downstairs, so I wasn't sure if I wanted to eat or dance around.  Maybe that's why we ate so fast, with music like that, how can you not?  Then again, this place has made me want to do my power walks at noon again.  Now, if only I can find one of those Walkmans with radios! 

Total bill, tax and tip included: $53.00

Update! 12.05.07 - Went back again, but this time I had the Gang Keaw with chicken ($7.95), "green curry in coconut milk with eggplant, zucchini, basil and bell pepper with chicken, tofu or prawns."  Pretty tasty stuff, and lots of eggplant and tofu.  I like to pour out all the curry on my rice so I can enjoy all the sauce!  Mary C. had the Pad See Ew ($7.95), "pan-fried rice noodle with egg and broccoli; choice of chicken, pork, beef, or tofu."  I enjoyed this dish too, and usually Mary C. has leftovers, but this time she finished it all herself!  Good stuff and loaded with broccoli! 

It does get busy around the 12:30 mark, so head in there early.  It's hard to get the waitress's attention when you're sitting downstairs as well.  But the food does come out quickly and it's a pretty good deal.  Can't beat that for a weekday lunch!

(You can find pics of our recent eating in the business profile!)
author: Teri C.

description: I had the fried chicken over fried rice (definitely a winner). The chicken doesn't have a greasy extra crunchy shell like most fried chicken do, instead it is lightly breaded and very tasty, especially with the sauce it comes with. The fried rice is also very tasty. The staff is very friendly and attends you as soon as you get there. I enjoy eating at Banana House.
author: Jessica U.

description: I have been here several times already and each experience has been positive. It is always packed during peak lunch time. The food is decent and so far, it has not made me disappointed yet. I have ordered the yellow curry with rice several times already. The portion,  the taste and presentation are good each time. I would definately come to this place for lunch.
author: Anonymous B.

description:
People in San Francisco can be so difficult when it comes to food. Come on people, it's not a Michelin starred restaurant. It's inexpensive, tasty Thai food with fresh ingredients cooked to order and even when delivered to your door, measures up better than 90% of Thai places anywhere in the country.  

Tonight they delivered a meal with damn near perfect green papaya salad, spicy eggplant and chicken laarb their Thai ancestors would be proud of. The ONLY thing I could find fault with them was I think rice should be included with entrees. But really, the folks panning this place with one and two and three stars have some unrealistic expectations. I WILL order from them again and expect to be just as satisfied next time.
author: Patty M.

description:
This place was great! Especially for the price you're paying. I have only tried one dish but I thought it was delicious. 
I placed my order 15 minutes before the lunch rush, walked  right over, and my meal was already prepared and ready to go. 
I got the silver noodle salad which comes packed with chicken, prawns, and some other seafood. The chili lime sauce was superb! They also have a bunch of sauces that you can take in to go cups- like peanut sauce and sweet and sour. 
I decided to sit outside since there were some open tables and one of the waitresses brought me a glass of water even though it was clear that I had gotten it to go. Very sweet of her. 

The portion was also really huge so I saved some of it for later. I can't wait to go back and get this salad again. It was packed with flavor and I catch myself craving it every now and then.
author: Cesie A.

description: Decent lunch portions. They're very flexible about the items you get (allowing for half and half of rice and pad thai).
author: Thomas C.

description: Pretty sure this place uses some serious MSG, because I got an incredibly nasty migraine after eating here, along with the usual stomach issues that I get when I ingest MSG.  The food is pretty good and pretty cheap (a 3-star kind of place) but if you are MSG-sensitive it is TOXIC.  They should state this on the menu.
author: Emmy T.

description:
This place really seemed like authentically cooked Thai food.  It didn't have that mass produced or frufry over-the-top chic Thai presentation that you see in Ohio or Pittsburgh.  
-Mussman Curry, rice and bottle of water for around $11.
author: Steve A.

description:
Since I'm a big fan of pumpkin season (and brews, lattes, bread, you name it) the pumpkin curry caught my eye. It was a lovely dish with plenty of spice and everything nice and all around well-crafted for the price (a lil less than $9 and portioned well). The chicken and pumpkin = tender in their own respective ways; the curry had a nice heat to it that didn't overpower. 

Yummy crab rangoon, made in a way I've not had before. Less greasy and with more interesting and tasty filling...!

Basically, this is an unpretentious pleasant Thai place with staff working almost meditatively in the back skewering what looked like curry kebabs. Prompt and efficient service. Definitely will be back for my Thai fix when I'm in the area and want to drop in for a quick lunch or dinner!
author: Lily T.

description: Been coming here for years.  Almost always get the Garlic Pan with chicken.  You're out for $10 and it's awesome every time.  Nice little salad and a good amount,  consistently fresh and excellent.   Don't know how they aren't more crowded. The free soup you get isn't to my liking, but it's not necessary so I just ask them to not bring it.
author: Marc S.

description:
My bf is a regular here, but I finally joined in with him for an early dinner today. I like their combo deal: an entree with 2 egg rolls, salad (yummy peanut-y dressing!), rice and either a Thai iced tea or coffee - awesome deal for about $11.50 before tax/tip. 

I had the chicken with cashews, pineapple, onions, red bell peppers and chili peppers - yum, very tasty (the sauce melds it all together so perfectly)! And my bf had the pad see ew, very good and tasty as well. We'll definitely be back for that entree combo!
author: Maile N.

description:
(See pics)

More of 3.5 stars.

Have been here quite a few times, either after work or lunch. Always solid food and good service.

The food can get quite spicy if you ask for it. It's with good sauce and juicy meat. While the meat is more of pre-frozen taste it's inexpensive and the seasoning makes up for it.

They have a basement as the upstairs can get packed quite frequently. It was spacious but I really don't like the smell. Upstairs was nice with open windows even it's more crowded.
author: T L.

description:
After the disappointment at Ebisu, my coworker (Jennifer M.) and I decided to check out Banana House across the street.  

There was a girl ready to take our order and the place was pretty packed for lunch.  I got basic fried rice with chicken, onions, tomato, cilantro, and snow peas for $8.70.  It took about 15-20 minutes.

The onions weren't cooked thoroughly with the fried rice so it was super fresh and had quite a bite.  (I love onions but usually, they cook it down a little so it's not so spicy)  The fried rice tasted lighter than, lets say, King of Thai fried rice but it was missing something.  Even after I smothered it in spicy chili sauce, it was missing some key component that I can't identify at the moment.. maybe it was Soul...

Seriously, can't beat King of Thai chicken fried rice for (less than) $7 PLUS free Thai iced tea!  

Careful of the door.. it swings in and out when someone closes it and if you're standing too close, it could seriously knock you out.  (It hit us a few times on the shoulder and it hurt!!)
author: Kat C.

description: Fantastic food at a modest price. Great place to pop into on the run being that it's in the financial district. Only negative point was a rush to bring me the check - twice.
author: Ed Z.

description:
This is a decent spot for lunch.  We ended up seated downstairs.  This was a bit like eating in a dingy basement.

The service was friendly and fast.

The food was fresh and good.  I had Pad Krao Prao which is a chicken dish.   It came with rice and a nice lil salad.
author: Mark D.

description:
When I first walked into this place, I was expecting typical financial district thai food that would be overpriced and underflavored.  I was wrong!

Banana House has a wide variety menu, but I went with the classic green curry with chicken, and didn't regret it for a minute.  Before my meal came, I got a bowl of soup (comes with lunch eat-in orders) which was really great.  Unexpected, but very appreciated.  The meal itself was very tasty, and a good quantity.  My one gripe is that the chicken to veggie ratio is a little high, but I'm guessing I'm in the minority for wishing they had less meat and more eggplant (which was real tasty).

I was very impressed by the speed at which my meal came.  Less than two minutes after I ordered I had a bowl of soup in front of me, and 2 minutes after that my food had arrived.

Banana House has become my go-to thai lunch place, and it should be yours too.
author: Dave S.

description: I was so hungry and there aren't a lot of options in the area on a Sunday afternoon. I start digging into my food. And as I start digging more into my steamed rice, I see a little black thing. Hungry, I pick it out and toss it, and continue to grub. But no, I dig further down the container, and black pebble like things throughout the container. They don't clean their food properly. Gross! Waste of money!
author: Tina C.

description:
PRICE: affordable, especially given it's location in the city. The servings are medium so you aren't getting less because of the cost.

SERVICE: the employees are pretty friendly, a lot of times they are hectic from the busy lunch rush that comes daily, being located in the Financial District means catering to thousands of hungry people.

FOOD: pretty darn good, I've eaten at a lot of Thai restaurants, but this place actually falls into the top 70 percentile. All the basics are delivered well; pad thai, papaya salad, red curry, green curry. 

SPACE: the seating is packed pretty tight on the main floor, but there is also seating one floor below. It's an older and less updated looking restaurant overall, but who cares? It's not dirty, just old.

Call in your order ahead of time if you are ordering takeout, you'll cut your wait time by 75%.
author: Kristine N.

description:
I used to go here for lunch every time I crave for good Thai food.
Their Pad Thai is one of my favorite pad thais, prik king with chicken is good even their sticky rice.

I have brought co-workers, hubby, my mom here.  I wish I still work around the area so I can get their pad thai.

call in for pick up if you don't want to it in.  it can be crowded during lunch.
author: Learnee L.

description: Came here for lunch with a friend... BIG MISTAKE!!!!  I had the pad broccoli and beef, which was the worst meal ever.  A bowl filled with boiled beef, broccoli, and oyster isn't my definition of a good meal.  I really want to go and show the chef how to cook..  The only thing good about the place is the staff, since they are friendly and nice, hence the one star.   In my opinion, if you want some good Thai "food", go elsewhere, this place is a dump!!  You'll be much happier spending a few extra $$ for the quality.. I know I would in hindsight!
author: Mike M.

description: Setting isn't the most trendy or updated but the food is excellent and the price is good. We got the Green Curry Beef and Pad Kee Mow. Great choices with flavor and balanced spice.
author: Clint H.

description:
Let me start off with this, banana house has no banana dishes! xD 
(except for fried banana, but that's not the point)

I went here for my birthday, and everybody seemed like they were having a good time. The waiters were nice, and the dishes were good! Well worth my money. The curry on the Gang Mussaman was perfect.

The only downside is that they charge you for rice, even if you're ordering curry. The owner picked up the fact that it was my birthday and gave me rice for free, so I guess I shouldn't be complaining. (: 

He also handed out all ten of us some lollipops afterwards! Sure was a sweet finish.
Definitely coming back!
author: Winnie J.

description:
When I first walk into here, I was confused, did my friend just rent out the whole place for dinner?  since there are suppose to be about 30 of us and this place look like it barely fits.  And where is everyone else?!  I am already 10 minutes late due to the ebil bay bridge traffic and I can't be the first one here.  (luck out on parking, usually its hard to found parking around here, but guess the parking god was on my side that day)  I finally realize there is a whole downstairs level for private parties.  Now this make more sense!

The service here was great, the waitress were attentive while not overbearing.  Seeing they have to carry the food down steep flights of stairs, I was pretty impressed.  The price was pretty reasonable for thai food too.  Average $8 per dish.

However, the food here was kinda hit and miss.  Some dishes taste awesome, while others are lackluster.  I really like the gang traffic jam dish, which is like 3 curries in one.  The spicy catfish were good too.  However, the thai salad was slightly too sour, and the mango in the sticky rice and mango wasn't ripe, thus not sweet and kinda stringy,   While most of the noodle dishes are standard.  Next time, i will stick with the curry dishes here and no dessert.

Remember to get the combo deal, with only $3.50 more, you got 2 spring rolls, some thai salad, and rice, along with thai ice tea/coffee.  (where the thai ice tea/coffee was $2 by itself, and the rice was $1 by itself)

One last thing to remember, the bathroom door is next to a pretty steep stairway, so watch your steps if  you don't want to break a leg or two.
author: Jim H.

description:
We ate at Banana House on a whim: we were in the area doing some shopping on a Sunday and they were one of the few places actually opened. We came in and were the only ones in there, so there was no wait which is a plus. 
I ordered the silver noodle salad with a side of jasmine rice. Unfortunately, I got regular rice. The seafood on the salad was pretty good, but overall, the dish was very hard to eat. The noodles were hidden under all of the seafood and the dressing was under the noodles. So, I didn't even see the dressing until I was almost done with the meal. 
I also got the sweet and sticky rice with mango for a dessert and it was a great way to end the meal. Overall, the service was pretty good. But, if I ate here again, I would order a different dish.
author: Alycia N.

description: Definitely should not have ignored the low reviews. After calling once to confirm my seamless order, when I called again 35 minutes after the delivery time the young man at the restaurant said, "I was supposed to call you after 5 to see if you would still like it delivered." When I asked him why he had not called yet or whether he did not get the earlier message from the first person I spoke to he just repeated the above. I don't have time to waste on incompetent delivery services.
author: Jeremy T.

description:
I've tried this place a few times in the hopes that the first 2-3 were flukes but i've now come to terms with the fact that it's just not good. Agreed that there is a lack of good thai food in the FD but this place is not helping. I've tried multiple things: Tom Kha, egg rolls, satay, pad thai, various curries etc and nothing was even mildly inspiring. A lot of the food lacks flavor which is saying alot because these dishes are normally filled with strong flavors. More grease than real spices which is unfortunate

Cheap and fast but won't please your taste buds.
author: sasha h.

description:
The Mango Curry w/Chicken is phenomenal! You can have it in house or take out, either way it tastes the same. The dish is served with your choice of chicken or prawns, mango, white rice or brown rice and a small salad drizzled with peanut sauce.  

What makes the dish is the mango curry sauce. The flavors I can make out are Red Bell Pepper, which adds a tangy taste with a hint of bitterness, Serrano Pepper that infuses the entire dish with enough heat to give flavor, but not burn your tongue, and the Mango Juice from the fruit itself that adds the sweetness to the curry. All of the flavors combine together to give you one satisfying mango curry infused with multiple levels of flavor in each bite. 

Every time I order the dish the flavor comes out consistent to each order, which makes it a reliably lunch time dish. Ordering online is super easy or if you want to order take out your order is ready in about 20 minutes. I highly recommend the Mango Curry w/Chicken.
author: Marco M.

description:
Yellow curry with chicken with brown rice ($6.95) Yeah I got brown rice! It's Halloween ok?! I gottah fit into my slutty costume tonight. Anyhoo....

Onions in it were completely RAW. WTF? Only veggie's were two sad ass potatoes, a few carrots and then the completely raw pieces of white onion. Chicken was dry. Curry flavor was pretty good but not spicy at all. The rice was well cooked though. The complimentary soup it came with tasted like celery and carrots in boiled water. At least it had tofu in it but it was bland and no bueno. The salad had a yummy peanut sauce on it but the salad itself consisted of nasty sad ass shredded iceberg lettuce and raw red onions. Again, no bueno. 

Side note: Service is lightening fast. They gave us the check like 2 seconds after we got our food. Oh wait, I think that's they're way of saying "hurry the fuck up, eat and get out."
author: Beverly T.

description:
We stopped by Banana House today for lunch since a lot of the restaurants I wanted to try were either closed or swarmed with people.  The restaurant was fairly empty, and service was good; they paid attention to us but didn't smother us.

I had the mango chicken and my friend had the pad thai with tofu; both were very good.  I highly recommend the mango chicken.  For the price, the pad thai was more food than I expected, and my dish was about the size I expected.  I've been charged more for less, and for less tasty food, so no complaints there.  We also each had a Thai iced tea/coffee: pretty sure they're the same thing since I asked for coffee and my friend asked for tea and we got the same thing, or just about.  It was also very good.

The restaurant is small, so I can see their being issues with waiting and takeout during rush hours, but the staff we met today were very pleasant.  I give four stars since it was a nice, solid meal but nothing exceptional.  I'd go back though, if I were in the area and in the mood for Thai.
author: Grace K.

description: I ordered my fave thai dish- the infamous Pad See Ewe with tofu and no eggs. It wasn't bad and the portion was just right for someone getting dinner after a nice workout. Nice enough people. Not sure if I would make it a point to come back.
author: Zannie S.

description:
Enjoyed a very good simple meal of Thai food.  My son and I had the Green Curry and it was tasty, my other son had the fried chicken which was ok, we had a chicken and cashew nut which was good and a yellow curry which was good.  Appetizers looked store bought vs made in store but they were hot
